The goal

Anticipate the user’s need for directions

Can we anticipate where our user might be going to next and give him/her directions straightaway?

Why

Citymapper has already made a step in the direction of providing customer with a quick way to access common routes from the homescreen with the Commute feature or through the Saved tab.

The next logical step in the same direction would be to have the app anticipate the customer’s need and give some strong suggestions on where he might be wanting to go, all from the comfort of his homescreen.

How

In order to do that, we need the right data to draw our assumptions from. Citymapper has access, among other things, to:

By cross checking these and other data sources, we can start anticipating where the user might be going next.

Conclusion

Citymapper has already made a step in the direction of providing customer with a quick way to access common routes from the homescreen with the Commute feature or through the Saved places tab.
The next logical step in the same direction would be to have the app anticipate the customer’s need and give some strong suggestions from inside the homescreen on where he might be wanting to go.
